title: Mulitple requests for Primary Password immediately after opening Firefox
content:
I installed Windows 11 and Firefox on a new PC. I used Firefox Sync to get my bookmarks onto the new PC. Firefox is version 101.0. I'm using Windows 11 Home, 10.0.22000, Build 22000.

When Firefox is opened it immediately asks for the Primary Password, then immediately asks for it again. I have to cancel the 2nd request before I can enter the PW in the first request.

Is there a fix for these multiple requests?

Thank you.

title: My self-signed *.local.dev wildcard SSL no longer works in v101.0
content:
After upgrading to v101, Firefox no longer recognizes my Self-signed wildcard SSL for *.local.dev.

Before you tell me not to use the .dev domain, I am aware that Google owns it and we're technically not supposed to do local development with the *.local.dev domain.

I have already tried the following: 1. Set network.stricttransportsecurity.preloadlist to FALSE, and everything was working perfectly fine before v101 2. imported the server.crt into Trusted Root Authorities in Windows, and also imported it in the Certificate manager in Firefox. 3. Tried other wildcard local domains like *.test.site, *.local.ddev and these don't work either.

I even tried following recent guides to issue a new certificate with openssl and SAN, and it still doesn't work.

Screenshot of wildcard SSL attached.
creator: chadreitsma1

title: Website compatability
content: Can not access PDF on a specific website when using Firefox 101.0. I can access with Google Chrome. title: Whatsapp and other sites reload after some minutes of inactivity
content:

So, when I switch back to that site, it reloads.

The main issue is with Whatsapp Web, as I don't get notification if I don't switch to the tab every now and then.

title: Firefox not working
content:
I have a user whose Firefox has stopped working. It will start up, but nothing ever is displayed in the window. The address bar and buttons are all there, but nothing from a web site, just a white page. If I enter a url, or click on a bookmark the refresh button never changed to an 'X', but I can see traffic from her machine going across our firewall. Try to go into setup and it's the same thing. About:config displays nothing. It's all just a blank page. Other browsers seem to work fine.

I've tried refreshing, and I've uninstalled and reinstalled, but it didn't fix it. Any ideas?

Thanks.

title: Strange line at the bottom of monitor above the active display
content:
Hi there,

I've been searching around for an answer to this for a while and have as yet been unable to find anything.

I have a multi-monitor set up, with one of my displays being above the main display, for some reason whenever I have Firefox, and specifically only Firefox, maximised, I get a bar that's either solid white, or has a portion of the browsers task bar appear at the bottom of the display above. If I put a video into full screen, or the browser into full screen, the bar disappears, likewise if I take the window out of maximised then it also disappears.

The only thing that I can think that might be contributing to this would be the fact that two displays have a different resolution, the main display being 2560 x 1440 and the top display being 1920 x 1080.

Any ideas to try to resolve this would be appreciated! Thank you to whoever reads this, and thank you for any possible advice to attempt to resolve this issue!
creator: emolg111

title: POPUP ADVERTS THAT ARE ANNOYING AND WASTE TIME DELETING THEM
content:
Hi All - I would like to see an app or Button where you can block emails or malicious sites that are continually poping up. I have noticed recently that there are more and more annoying popup and incoming junk these days Can you PLEASE PLEASE create a Blocker to prevent mallisious and annoying adverts that seem to be getting worse and worse. I find sometimes I spend 10 - 15 minutes a day trying to block unwanted spam in Thunderbird and Firefox. I alway use Firefox as I believe it is the best of all sites PLEASE PLEASE add a Blocking App. Its like getting JUNK MAIL INTO OUR LETTERBOX AT HOME. I have removed my letterbox totally and all my mail is sent to a P.O. Box. now and that solved e problem. PLEASE PLEASE Do something about the spam and adverts that waste time and are Very Very Annoying. 

                                                                                        Thankyou in advance. A supporter of Mozilla Firefox

Signed Arthur Rees 

                                     my email is lornart@internode.on.net    Glenelg Australia PC 5045
